content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:syn="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/" xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/">             <channel rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/search_rss">   <title>Environmental Information Data Centre</title>   <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk</link>    <description>                  These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 3.            </description>            <image rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/logo.png"/>    <items>     <rdf:Seq>                <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/3f0820a7-a8c8-4dd7-a058-8db79ba9c7fe"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/24200dba-d0f4-4be4-ae6f-2c6ec1147fa4"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/dc33a786-9798-4ef3-9e66-22707ae40d67"/>            </rdf:Seq>   </items>  </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/3f0820a7-a8c8-4dd7-a058-8db79ba9c7fe">     <title>Five year record of aquatic carbon and greenhouse gas concentrations from Auchencorth Moss</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/3f0820a7-a8c8-4dd7-a058-8db79ba9c7fe</link>     <description>Dataset contains concentrations of particulate and dissolved organic carbon, inorganic carbon, CO2, CH4 and N2O in the Black Burn stream which drains Auchencorth Moss peatland in South East Scotland. Auchencorth Moss is part of the Centre for Ecology & Hydrology's UK Carbon Catchment project. Concentrations have been measured approximately weekly from January 2007 to December 2011 and are published in Global Change Biology doi: 10.1111/gcb.12209</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>David Leaver</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>dissolved organic carbon</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>dissoved inorganic carbon</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>carbon dioxide</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>methane</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>nitrous oxide</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>particulate organic carbon</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>aquatic</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>peatland</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Carbon Catchments</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Auchencorth Moss</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Scotland</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Black Burn</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>stream water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>peatland</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>weekly</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-12-10T16:06:40Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/24200dba-d0f4-4be4-ae6f-2c6ec1147fa4">     <title>Dissolved polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) and dissolved organic carbon (DOC) in the River Wyre (northwest England)</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/24200dba-d0f4-4be4-ae6f-2c6ec1147fa4</link>     <description>Data on concentrations of dissolved PAHs and dissolved organic carbon (DOC) in 20 water samples collected from the River Wyre at five sites between Marshaw Wyre, one of the two headwaters of the River Wyre, and Garstang from August 2010 to June 2011. As typical for this region, the upland reaches of this river drain peatland areas, resulting in a relatively high dissolved organic carbon content. PAHs were measured as freely dissolved PAHs (i.e. freely dissolved in the water phase) and total dissolved PAHs (the sum of freely dissolved and those associated with DOC) and the fractions associated with DOC have been estimated from these two. Where possible, the DOC-water partition coefficient of the PAHs, calculated from the concentrations determined, is given as well. The data is presented as one table and two supporting files containing metadata. </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Jacky Chaplow</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>DOC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>PAH</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>dissolved organic carbon</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>England</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>upland river</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River Wyre</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Freshwater</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>stream</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>peat</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Between August 2010 and June 2011</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Biogeochemistry Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-11-05T15:12:35Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/dc33a786-9798-4ef3-9e66-22707ae40d67">     <title>Chemistry of iron in freshwaters of Northwest England</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/dc33a786-9798-4ef3-9e66-22707ae40d67</link>     <description>Chemical composition of freshwater samples from sites in Northern England. Measurements of pH, dissolved major ions (Na, Mg, K, Ca, Cl, NO3, SO4), dissolved organic carbon (DOC), dissolved Al, Fe(II) and total Fe, and measurements of Al, Fe(II) and total Fe on samples following dialysis. A view service identifying sample locations is also available</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Dan Wright</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>
